text: Rhinovirus replication increases expression of TLR3 mRNA and TLR3 protein on the cell surface and blocking TLR3 leads to a decrease in IL-6, CXCL8, and CCL5 in response to poly (IC) but an increase following rhinovirus infection. This demonstrates an important functional requirement for TLR3 in the host response against rhinovirus infection, indicates that poly (IC) is not always a good model for studying the biology of live viral infections [30] and suggests that poly (IC) could be utilized therapeutically because of differences in mechanisms of action. The RIG-I/MDA-5 pathway is important in the induction of type I IFN following rhinovirus infection, however, rhinovirus is able to inhibit IPS-1 in order to evade this arm of the immune response [88] , Fig. (1) .
